about.introduction: Hey! Welcome, I'm Marco Tomás Rodríguez

content.title: Software Engineer
points: Built backend services with Spring Boot, TimescaleDB/PostgreSQL and Redis following TDD practices.
Set up highly available, fault tolerant infrastructure using GCP and Kubernetes.
Architected a reading ingestion system with analytics and reporting capabilities.
Worked with time-series and geographical information database systems (TimescaleDB / PostGIS).
Implemented CI/CD pipeline with GitHub Actions.
Designed a cost-effective low-power asset-tracking IoT device, including printed circuit boards and electrical schematics.
Developed firmware for ARM microcontrollers from Nordic Semiconductor.

content.title: Software Engineer
points: Designed and implemented a modular, extensible and maintainable, event-driven backend architecture for an IoT device system.
Collaborated with other companies to develop an integration layer for third party backend services.
Designed a standard for internal batch processing APIs.
Improved the backend system's reliability and maintainability by applying consistent design patterns, increasing test coverage and writing documentation.
Implemented CI/CD pipelines with Gitlab CI for backend and firmware codebases including automated physical device tests.
Assisted firmware and frontend development teams to troubleshoot issues and propose solutions.
Reduced the backend service's latency by 60% by optimizing deployment regions.
Deployed and monitored backend infrastructure in AWS.
Led the development of an AI-based acoustic sensor IoT device that improves the resource’s control efficiency and increases the productivity up to 30%.
Built audio collection, processing and storage pipeline used to train a machine learning algorithm using AWS S3 buckets.
Engineered efficient edge-device audio processing pipelines with a 41x improvement with the preexistent version.
Built controller and task scheduling software for an AI-based acoustic sensor using Python and Linux.
